alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 8:58AM EST until January 28 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. .Rainfall overnight of 0.50 inches to 0.75 inches has resulted in additional rises on Stillwater Creek. These rises will cause the creek to rise above the flood stage of 10.0 feet. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillwater Creek comes out of its banks in several locations resulting in overflowing in poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of low lying areas begins. At 11.5 feet, Flood waters of Stillwater Creek will reach the intersection of East 12th Street and North Main Street in Uhrichsville and approach Newport Street. Little Stillwater Creek will flood most of Phac Park along with portions of Wilson Road in Dennison. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 10.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening to 9.7 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will rise to 9.8 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.
